Hi,

> As Noah notes, PUT is preferred if you want to perform a RESTful replace 
> of the server-side file.
yeah, of course. Somehow did not think about that! :) So, now it works,
except one little thing: the data that I am sending (with PUT) is
missing all line feeds! I think I have tested almost everything (at
least I really don't know of anything I have not tried :)).

What is working client side is this:

---snip---
HttpPut put = new HttpPut(url);
put.setEntity(new ByteArrayEntity(data.getBytes("UTF-8"));
HttpResponse r = client.execute(put);
---snap---

(encoding really is utf-8!). I did try setting the "Content-Type" to
"application/xml" but with no luck. I also tried a MultipartEntity like:

---snip---
MultipartEntity mp = new MultipartEntity();
mp.addPart("contents", new StringBody(data));
---snap---

again with no luck. Everytime the newlines are missing. Using cUrl also
does not help. There the newlines are missing as well!

Any ideas?

Best
Daniel
